name: Advanced Sushi Quiz | International Cuisine | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following sushi items is served cooked?
questions.explanation:
Kani.

	Kani is crab. It is not served raw. Other items that are cooked include ebi (shrimp) tamago (egg), soft-shell crab, mussels, and the different varieties of eel.

questions.text: What is that green pasty stuff called that is served as a sushi condiment?
questions.explanation:
Wasabi.

	Wasabi is also called Japanese horseradish and it is HOT! Some unfortunate sushi first-timers have assumed it is indeed guacamole or an avocado product...

questions.text: And what is that green stuff a variant of?
questions.explanation:
Horseradish.

	Used sparingly, wasabi - the Japanese horseradish used in sushi - is an excellent food enhancer and sinus clearer!

questions.text: Which of these dishes is typically served accompanied by the deep-fried head of the creature that was transformed into sushi?
questions.explanation:
Ama ebi.

	Ama ebi is 'sweet shrimp', a special variety served only raw. While sushi gourmets appreciate the crispy treat, many diners are unnerved by the beady black eyes peering up at them from the plate!

questions.text: Which of the following sushi types is not a mollusk?
questions.explanation:
Unagi.

	Unagi is freshwater eel, a fish. Ika is squid, mirugai is clam, hotategai is scallop.

questions.text: What is the Japanese name of the seaweed that is used to wrap most sushi?
questions.explanation:
Nori.

	The sheets are made from the purple laver seaweed, pressed, dried and toasted.

questions.text: Which of the following sushi varieties are vegetarian?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	Kappa maki is cucumber, umeboshi is pickled plum, and inari are fried tofu pouches stuffed with rice.

questions.text: Which sushi is made from a sweet, thick egg omelet?
questions.explanation:
Tamago.

	Absolutely delicious, and good for the first-time sushi explorer.

Sea urchin eggs.

	Not my favorite, but some love its color and texture.

questions.text: What word, as it is typically spelled on American menus, means both a type of Japanese alcoholic beverage and salmon when said out loud?
questions.explanation:
Sake & saki.

	I have been informed that the Japanese spellings are actually different.

questions.text: What is the richest cut of sushi tuna called?
questions.explanation:
Toro.

	It is the fattiest cut, from the belly of the tuna.

questions.text: OK, now for a less appetizing morsel. All of the following are genuinely used in sushi, but which one is called shirako?
options: Live shrimp that are still squirming
Green material from the head of a crab
questions.explanation:
Sperm sacs of the codfish.

	I have not seen any of these in US sushi restaurants, however! I was informed by larstheodd that "You can get shirako at Sushizo in Los Angeles. It comes with the "small" omakase for $45.50. You might also find it at Urasawa in Beverly Hills, but I haven't been there yet - prices start at $250.00 per person and $350 is the norm. You might see celebrities there, however. Tom Cruise likes it."

questions.text: What is the Japanese name for the pickled ginger served alongside sushi?
questions.explanation:
Gari & Shoga & Beni shoga.

	This ginger is dyed pink; its natural color is off-white.

questions.text: Which of the following is not typically found in a California roll?
questions.explanation:
Cream cheese.

	One of the pedestrian, popular types of 'mass-market' sushi, usually made with fake crab.

questions.correct: Sushi is made with rice, sashimi is just raw fish
options: Sushi always has a seaweed wrapper, sashimi does not
Sushi is raw, sashimi is cooked
Sushi is seafood, sashimi is meat
questions.explanation:
Sushi is made with rice, sashimi is just raw fish.

	Sashimi, like sushi, is presented in a very artistic manner.
